thread.section_title: Sports - Southwest Daily News - Sulphur, LA
thread.title: Knights rally from first half deficit to beat Rams
thread.title_full: Knights rally from first half deficit to beat Rams

author: Rodrick Anderson
title: Knights rally from first half deficit to beat Rams
text:
Knights rally from first half deficit to beat Rams WESTLAKE — The Westlake Rams had all the right stuff in the first half but South Beauregard had Shea Holland who led the Golden Knights to a come from behind 27-24 win on Friday at Westlake Ram Stadium. Comment Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 2:30 PM Westlake, La. 
3-31 PUNT 4-29 

RUSHING: SOUTH BEAUREGARD – Shea Holland 38-303, 4TD; Colton Fowler 8-42; Hayden Gunter 6-(-1); Team 1-(-20). WESTLAKE – Joseph January 4-49, TD; Michael Boudreaux 7-16; Brevin Ned 4-16; Hunter Racca 9-5. 
PASSING: SOUTH BEAUREGARD – Gunter 2-11-0, 0yds. WESTLAKE – Racca 20-31-2, 137yds, 2TD. 
RECEIVING: SOUTH BEAUREGARD – Holland 1-5; Jansen Fontenot 1-(-5). WESTLAKE – Boudreaux 6-46, TD; Meleick Pappion 3-32; January 4-31, TD; Cade Witherwax 2-11; Brayden Winn 3-9; Hayden Banks 2-8. 
SCORING 
WL – Hunter Racca 8yd pass to Michael Boudreaux (Jonathan Peshoff XP) 2 nd Quarter 
WL – Racca 25yd pass to Joseph January (Peshoff XP) 
SB – Shea Holland 4yd run (XP failed) 
3 rd Quarter 
SB – Holland 4yd run (Holland run) 
WL – Peshoff 31yd FG 
SB – Holland 17yd run (#1 XP) 
4 th 
SB – Holland 57yd run (2pt conv. Failed) 
WL – January 19yd run (Peshoff XP) • SDN Photos: South Beauregard 27, Westlake 24 WESTLAKE — The Westlake Rams had all the right stuff in the first half but South Beauregard had Shea Holland who led the Golden Knights to a come from behind 27-24 win on Friday at Westlake Ram Stadium. “You have to credit Westlake,” South Beauregard head coach Dwight Hudler said. “They came out on fire and we didn’t. “We don’t have a sense of urgency right now and we need to. Luckily for us we were able to respond. The defense stood up and made a lot of plays when they needed to and the offense got rolling again just enough. If we want to have a chance to get better and continue to win games we are going to have to play better.” Holland, who had missed two of the Knights’ previous three games, rushed for 303 yards on 38 carries and scored all four of the Knights’ touchdowns. “He is back healthy now,” Hudler said. “We are trying to protect him. He took a lot of hits early on in the season.” South Beauregard ended a two-game losing streak despite turning the ball over twice on fumbles in the first half. After forcing the Knights to punt on the opening drive, Westlake marched 60 yards on seven plays to take a 7-0 lead on an eight-yard pass from Hunter Racca to Michael Boudreaux with 6:02 left in the first quarter. South Beauregard fumbled the ball away on the ensuing kickoff and the Rams got to the Knights’ two-yard line before Racca pass on a fake field goal attempt on fourth down sailed past the out stretched arms of Brayden Winn. South Beauregard got to mid field on their next drive but fumbled the ball again and Westlake pushed their lead to 14-0 with 10:29 left in the first half on a 25-yard pass from Racca to Joseph January but unfortunately the lead didn’t stick. “I feel bad for these kids,” Westlake head coach Phil Fontenot said. “They know that we always talk about it takes time to turn a program around but doggone it we were close tonight. “The kids fought. It doesn’t have anything to do with Xs and Os. It has everything to do with heart and I am very proud of them for having heart tonight.” South Beauregard trailed 14-6 at halftime, but just under three minutes into the second half, Holland scored on a four-yard run and ran in the two-point conversion to tie the game at 14-14. The drive started after Marshall Larocque intercepted Racca with 10:50 left in the third quarter. Westlake got the lead back one more time, 17-14, on a 31-yard field goal by Jonathan Peshoff with 2:40 left in the third. Page 2 of 2 - It took the Knights just over two and a half minutes to take back the lead, 21-17, for good on a 17-yard run by Holland with nine seconds left in the third quarter. Trailing 27-17, Westlake put together a 10-play, 70 yard drive capped by a 19-yard touchdown on a reverse by January to pull within three, 27-24, with 6:58 left in the game. Westlake forced the Knights to punt with 3:27 left lost four yards on their next drive and turned the ball over on downs with 1:35 left. Westlake (2-6, 1-2) will travel to Jennings (4-4, 2-1) on Friday while South Beauregard (6-2, 1-2) will host Iowa (4-4, 2-1) on Friday.
